attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories (OtherCues)

name: germinative response to NaNO2
definition: The germinative response after exposure to sodium nitrite (NaNO2). For studies where differences were not statistically tested, the criteria in Paula & Pausas (2008) are used.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories (OtherCues)

name: germinative response to NH4Cl
definition: The germinative response after exposure to ammonium chloride (NH4Cl). For studies where differences were not statistically tested, the criteria in Paula & Pausas (2008) are used.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories (OtherCues)

name: germinative response to NH4NO3
definition: The germinative response after exposure to ammonium nitrate (NH4NO3). For studies where differences were not statistically tested, the criteria in Paula & Pausas (2008) are used.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories (OtherCues)

name: germinative response to NH4HCO3
definition: The germinative response after exposure to  ammonium bicarbonate (NH4HCO3). For studies where differences were not statistically tested, the criteria in Paula & Pausas (2008) are used.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories (OtherCues)

name: germination stimulation
definition: Germination of the treated seeds is significantly higher than the control.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories: Heat-Stimulated Germination (HeatStimGerm), Other Cues (OtherCues)

name: germination unaffected
definition: Germination is not affected by the treatment, i.e., germination of treated seeds equals the control.  In the case of heat treatments, germination is not stimulated after any heat intensity tested, and at least one of the treatments does not affect seed germination.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories: Heat-Stimulated Germination (HeatStimGerm), Other Cues (OtherCues)

name: geophyte
definition: Herb that persists during the unfavourable period as bulb, rhizome or other subterranean storage organ.

name: large shrub
definition: Large shrub or small tree. Tall woody plant that under optimal conditions may reach arborescence structure.

name: resprout ability after disturbance
definition: Resprouting ability after an undefined disturbance that removed most of the aboveground biomass.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (RespDist), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: mm^3
definition: An area unit which is equal to 10^-9 m^3.

name: simultaneous hermaphrodite
definition: Some members of this lineage are simultaneous hermaphrodites; a condition of hermaphroditic animals (and plants) in which the reproductive organs of both sexes are present and functional at the same time.

name: dioecious
definition: Dioecy (Greek: "two households"; adjective form: dioecious) is characterised by a species having distinct male and female organisms.
attribution: K. S. Bawa (1980). "Evolution of Dioecy in Flowering Plants". Annual Review of Ecology and Systematics 11: 15–39.

name: integument
definition:
integument differs between males and females. Includes the size, number, distribution or shape of cilia, scales, spines, hooks, bristles, feathers, hair, horns and teeth. Although not integmental structures, the 
antlers of mammals are included in this category because they are analogous in function to the sexually-selected horns and spines of other animals.
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: appendages
definition: appendages differ between males and females. Includes the number, size and shape of locomotory and sensory appendages such as antennae, legs, wings, and fins, as well as non-genital appendages modified to act as intromittent organs. Tail dimorphisms are not included.
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: brood pouch
definition: brood pouches have been reported
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: dwarf males
definition: dwarf males have been reported
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: intromission
definition: male genitalia are modified for intromission
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: genital opening
definition: genital opening differs between males and females
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: visible gonads
definition: gonads in one sex are visible
attribution: Fairbairn DJ (2013) Data from: Odd couples: extraordinary differences between the sexes in the animal kingdom. Dryad Digital Repository. doi:10.5061/dryad.n48cm

name: procumbent
definition: Growing horizontal to the ground without setting roots.

name: trailing
definition: Growing along the ground.

name: twining
definition: Growing upwards by revolving around and leaning on a supporting structure.

name: arborescent
definition: Of habit, resembling a tree, a term applied to non-woody plants attaining tree height and to shrubs tending to become tree-like in size
attribution: Stevens, P. F. (2001 onwards). Angiosperm Phylogeny Website. Version 12, July 2012.  http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossarya_h.html#C

name: testicond
definition: Undescended testacles, the ancestral condition in mammals.

name: inguinal
definition: Descended but ascrotal testes, a derived condition in mammals.

name: scrotal
definition: Testes are located outside of the body, suspended by the spermatic cord within the scrotum.

name: cursorial
definition: This organism is adapted for running

name: testis location
definition: Anatomical location of testis; eg: internal, descended, scrotal, inguinal.

name: calf
definition: The young of various large animals (e.g. elephants, whales, and dolphins).

name: pup
definition: One of the young of various animals; as a seal or rat or a dog.

name: yearling
definition: An animal one year old or in the second year of its life.

name: visits flowers of
definition: The organisms is a known flower visit of the target species.  It may or may not be an effective pollinator.

name: flowers visited by
definition: The flowers of this plant are visited by the listed organism.  It may or may not be an effective pollinator.

name: mm Hg
definition: millimeters of mercury. A unit of pressure equal to the amount of fluid pressure one millimeter deep in mercury at zero degrees centigrade on Earth.

name: blood pressure
definition: Blood pressure (BP), sometimes referred to as arterial blood pressure, is the pressure exerted by circulating blood upon the walls of blood vessels, and is one of the principal vital signs. When used without further specification, "blood pressure" usually refers to the arterial pressure of the systemic circulation. During each heartbeat, blood pressure varies between a maximum (systolic) and a minimum (diastolic) pressure.

name: log10 km^2
definition: A decimal multiple of the SI unit of surface area, the square metre, expressed on a logarithmic-scale (base 10).

name: calcified
definition: A composition quality inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's being encrusted or impregnated with calcium carbonate

name: found near
definition: this organism has been found near the associate. No evidence of relationship except proximity

name: emerged from
definition: this organism has been observed emerging from the associate.

name: collected on
definition: this organism has been found on the associate.

name: collected in
definition: this organism has been found in the associate; implies that the associate was dissected

name: hyperparasitoid of
definition: this organism is a parasite of a known parasite of the target organism

name: reared from
definition: this organism has emerged from the associate in controlled conditions

name: protruding sulcus
definition: A state of the sulcus wherein it protrudes into the epicone instead of remaining solely in the hypocone.

name: straight sulcus
definition: A state of the sulcus wherein it does not protrude into the epicone and remains solely in the hypocone

name: non-displaced cingulum
definition: A type of cingulum wherein both ends meet evenly on the ventral side of the cell. There is no displacement in either direction.

name: phagocytosis
definition: An endocytosis process that results in the engulfment of external particulate material by phagocytes. The particles are initially contained within phagocytic vacuoles (phagosomes), which then fuse with primary lysosomes to effect digestion of the particles.

name: colorless
definition: A color quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's lacking color.

name: absent
definition: A quality denoting the lack of an entity.

name: descending cingulum
definition: A state of the cingulum wherein the end of the cingulum is lower than the beginning. Facing the ventral side of the cell, the cingulum on your right-hand side is higher than the cingulum on your left-hand side.

name: posterior
definition: The opposite of anterior

name: bent
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having one or more angle(s) in its length.

name: asymmetric
definition: A symmetry quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's lacking symmetry.

name: pre median location
definition: The location of a structure that is anterior relative to the mid point.

name: broad flat cone
definition: A 3D cone shape that is characterized by having a base diameter much larger than the height.

name: calcite
definition: Calcium carbonate (CO3Ca), calcite structure

name: calcium carbonate
definition: A carbonate salt that has formula CO3Ca

name: aragonite
definition: Calcium carbonate (CO3Ca), aragonite structure

name: apatite
definition: Calcium carbonate (CO3Ca), apatite structure

name: biogenic silica
definition: A biogenic mineral comprised of hydrated silica

name: measurement
definition: A measurement is an information entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by an instrument.

name: early April
definition: Near the beginning of the fourth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: early June
definition: Near the beginning of the sixth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: early May
definition: Near the beginning of the fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: late April
definition: Near the end of the fourth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: late March
definition: Near the end of the third month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: late May
definition: Near the end of the fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: mid April
definition: Near the middle of the fourth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: mid June
definition: Near the middle of the sixth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: mid May
definition: Near the middle of the fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: no stratification
definition: Seeds do not require stratification (simulation of winter conditions) for germination to occur.

name: scarification
definition: Scarification is the cutting of the seed coat using abrasion, thermal stress, or chemicals to aid germination

name: soaking
definition: Seeds may be soaked in liquid to aid germination.

name: refrigerate
definition: Immediately after cleaning store seeds moist in a refrigerator until sowing outside or sowing in container.

name: cold moist stratification
definition: Cold moist stratification in a refrigerator in a plastic freezer bag.

name: sow in container or outside
definition: Sow seed immediately in container and keep watered outside or sow outside.

name: moist storage to avoid deep dormancy
definition: Deep dormancy if seed dries out. Store seed moist in the refrigerator.

name: plant division
definition: The cutting of a multi-stemmed plant into clumps that are then replanted.

name: dry seed storage
definition: Seeds may be stored dry.

name: prolonged dry seed storage
definition: Seed stores for several years dry.

name: macerate
definition: Macerate (mash) berries to remove skin and pulp (sieves work well).

name: no treatment
definition: No treatment necessary to get a minimum of 50% germination.

name: sow outside in soil
definition: Sow outside immediately in soil and label or sow in container.

name: scarify and soak
definition: Scarify seed then pour boiling water over seed and let soak for 24 hours.

name: soak
definition: Pour boiling water over seed and let soak for 24 hours.

name: soak and cold moist stratification
definition: Pour boiling water over seed and let soak for 24 hours and cold moist stratification in refrigerator in a plastic freezer bag.

name: spores
definition: Propagation by spores.

name: sow on soil surface
definition: Seeds require sunlight to germinate (sow seed on surface).

name: air-dry seed pods
definition: Air-dry seed pods (may require collecting early and caging to catch fluffy seed or exploding seed pods)

name: bag method
definition: Seeds easily fall when shaken or stripped into an open bag.

name: crack dry capsules
definition: Crack dry capsules under foot or with rolling pin.

name: fluffy seeds pose fire hazard
definition: Fluffy seed can be messy and can catch fire/potential fire hazard.

name: grind hard dry fruit
definition: Grind hard dry fruit in a leaf grinder or stomp under foot.

name: shatter, rub, or beat soft dry fruit
definition: Shatter soft dry fruit by hand or rub against coarse screen or beat with a rake or broom.

name: mash ripe berries
definition: Mash ripe berries in a sieve or colander and remove skin and pulp.

name: sand seed
definition: Sand seed between two sheets of sandpaper to remove hull.

name: wide and deep
definition: A depth quality which is relatively high and a width which is relatively large

name: present
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's existence.

name: hemispherical
definition: A shape distinguished by its resemblance to a half sphere

name: median
definition: The location of a structure that is at the mid point.

name: straight
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being free of curves, bends, or angles.

name: symmetrical
definition: A symmetry quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being capable of division by a longitudinal plane into similar halves.

name: ochre
definition: A moderate yellow-orange to orange color.

name: pointed
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a point.

name: centered
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located in a position equidistant from edges.

name: deep
definition: A depth quality which is relatively high.

name: anterior
definition: The opposite of posterior

name: disc shaped
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being cylindrical, in which the height is less than the diameter.

name: peripheral
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being at the edge or boundary of a related entity.

name: clustered
definition: A spatial pattern inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being gathered or tending to gather into a mass or whole.

name: numerous
definition: A qualitative quantity defined by the presence of more instances of the bearer than are easily counted.

name: postmedian
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located in a position posterior of the center point.

name: parietal
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being very near or attached to a structural wall.

name: transverse division
definition:
a common mode of asexual reproduction among 
skeletonless coelenterates and also in some skeletal anthozoans (division of the soft body must be associated with division of the skeleton).
attribution: Stolarski, J. 1991. Transverse division in a Miocene scleractinian coral. Acta Palaeontologica Polonica 36 (4): 413-426

name: colonial
definition: A colonial organism is an organism composed of multiple constituent organisms. The organisms can be unicellular, as in the simple plant Volvox (a coenobium), or multicellular, as in the Portuguese man o' war.

name: attached to substrate
definition: This organism is normally physically attached to the substrate upon which it lives

name: ferment in bag
definition: Allow fruit to ferment in bag then remove seeds.

name: extract seed from fresh fruit
definition: Remove husks when fruit begins to soften, do not allow to dry.

name: keep saturated with water
definition: Sow outdoors in containers without drainage holes and keep saturated with water.

name: sow outside
definition: Parasitic plant. Sow directly in garden or in nature.

name: sow early in greenhouse
definition: The plant develops slowly in greenhouse production.  Sow early in the season.

name: sow late in greenhouse
definition: The plant develops rapidly in greenhouse production.  Sow late in the season.

name: lower confidence limit
definition: a data item which is a lowest value bounding a confidence interval

name: upper confidence limit
definition: upper confidence limit is a data item which is a largest value bounding a confidence interval

name: coefficient of variation
definition: a normalized measure of dispersion of a probability distribution of frequency distribution.

name: genome size
definition: The amount of DNA (or RNA) in one copy of a genome.

name: rod shaped
definition: A convex 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting a consistently-sized round cross section.

name: lens shaped
definition: A concave 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's shape form resembling the shape of a lens.

name: bell shaped
definition: A concave 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's shape form resembling the shape of a bell.

name: narrow
definition: A width which is relatively small.

name: wedge shaped
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being narrowly triangular, wider at the apex and tapering toward the base.

name: chick
definition: A bird that has not yet reached adulthood

name: log10
definition: The value has been transformed by a log10 function.

name: flower
definition: A determinate reproductive shoot system that has as part at least one carpel or at least one stamen and does not contain any other determinate shoot system as a part.

name: leaf
definition: A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is not associated with a reproductive structure.

name: dietary gum
definition: A class of water soluble polysaccharides usually isolated from seeds and typically viscous in aqueous solution. (DRI)

name: bark
definition: All tissues outside the vascular cambium or the xylem; in older trees may be divided into dead outer bark and living inner bark, which consists of secondary phloem.

name: nectar
definition: A sweet liquid that is secreted by the nectaries of a plant and is the chief raw material of honey.

name: faunivore
definition: An animal that eats primarily other animals (includes insectivores and carnivores);
attribution: J.G. Fleagle, 1988. Primate Adaptation and Evolution, Academic Press, New York.

name: folivore
definition: An animal that mainly eats leaves and flowers.

name: frugivore
definition: An animal that mainly eats fruit.

name: gumnivore
definition: An animal that eats exudates- gums, saps, or resins.
attribution: J.G. Fleagle, 1988. Primate Adaptation and Evolution, Academic Press, New York

name: invertebrates
definition: An animal lacking a vertebral column. This group consists of 98% of all animal species.

name: Vertebrata
definition: A subphylum of animals consisting of those having a bony or cartilaginous vertebral column.

name: narrow and deep
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having depth quality which is relatively high and a width which is relatively small

name: ascending cingulum
definition: A state of the cingulum wherein the end of the cingulum is higher than the beginning. Facing the ventral side of the cell, the cingulum on your right-hand side is lower than the cingulum on your left-hand side.

name: rounded conical
definition: A convex 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's resembling a cone (a 3-D shape with a round cross section that tapers), with a blunt end instead of a pointed end.

name: radial
definition: emanating from a common central point; arranged like the radii of a circle

name: shallow
definition: A depth which is relatively low.

name: environmental position
definition: Living location of the organism in relation to the water column, the sea floor and other organisms.

name: epibenthic
definition: Living on the surface of the seabed

name: endobenthic
definition: Living within the sediment of the seabed but not in interstitial space.

name: interstitial
definition: Living in the spaces between grains in a sediment

name: hyperbenthic
definition: Living above but close to the substratum

name: epilithic
definition: Attached to / growing on the surface of rock

name: endolithic
definition: Organism that colonize the interior of any kind of rock but not actively boring into it

name: lithotomous
definition: Actively boring into rocks and living in these burrows

name: boring in biogenic substrate
definition: Boring in biogenic hard substrate and living in these burrows

name: epizoic
definition: Growing or living on or in a living animal (but not parasitic upon it)

name: epiphytic
definition: Growing on or in a living plant (but not parasitic upon it)

name: prosome length
definition: Length of the prosome of an arthropod. Prosome: anterior region of body, commonly limited behind by major articulation. Collective term for the combined cephalasome and metasome in copepods

name: prosome width
definition: Width of the prosome of an arthropod. Prosome: anterior region of body, commonly limited behind by major articulation. Collective term for the combined cephalasome and metasome in copepods

name: prosome height
definition: Height (dorso-ventral distance) of the prosome of an arthropod. Prosome: anterior region of body, commonly limited behind by major articulation. Collective term for the combined cephalasome and metasome in copepods

name: locomotion
definition: Self-propelled movement of a cell or organism from one location to another.

name: copepodid stage 2
definition: The second post-naupliar life stage of a copepod. All copepodid stages are characterised by two pairs of unsegmented swimming appendages, and an unsegmented "hind-body" comprising the thorax and the abdomen. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copepodid#Copepoda)

name: copepodid stage 6
definition: The sixth post-naupliar life stage of a copepod. All copepodid stages are characterised by two pairs of unsegmented swimming appendages, and an unsegmented "hind-body" comprising the thorax and the abdomen. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copepodid#Copepoda)

name: generation time
definition: In population biology, the generation time is a quantity that reflects the average time between two consecutive generations. Reciprocal of Generation Frequency

name: type specimen repository
definition: The institution that holds a type specimen for a given species.  The recommended best practice is to use the identifier in a collections registry such as the Biodiversity Collections Index (http://www.biodiversitycollectionsindex.org/).

name: wide and shallow
definition: A depth quality which is relatively low and a width which is relatively large

name: narrow and shallow
definition: A depth quality which is relatively low and a width which is relatively low

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM)
definition:
National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA.
NMNH and USNM both refer to the National Museum of Natural History. Collections are associated with one or the other acronym. US, the US National Herbarium, is a collection within the National Museum of Natural History.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.mnh.si.edu/rc/
URL for institutional specimen catalog: http://collections.mnh.si.edu/

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Botany Department
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Botany Department.  Washington, District of Columbia, USA. Primarily dried specimens (e.g., skins, herbarium sheets).  URL for collection:  http://botany.si.edu/index.htm

name: larval development
definition: A life cycle characterized by having a larval phase. The larval phase is typically distinct in form and is followed by metamorphosis into an adult.

name: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia (ANSP)
definition: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia (ANSP).  Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.acnatsci.org/

name: Christian D. Jersabek Collection
definition: Christian D. Jersabek, personal working collection, Salzburg, Austria

name: paedomorphic
definition: Heterochronous homology that is produced by a retention in adults of a species of traits previously seen only in juveniles.

name: Mongolian National University (MNUFR)
definition: Mongolian National University (MNUFR).  Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.

name: Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences (RBINS)
definition:
Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences (RBINS).  Brussels, Belgium. URL for main institutional website: http://www.naturalsciences.be/
URL for institutional specimen catalog: http://darwin.naturalsciences.be/

name: Hendrik Segers Collection
definition: Hendrik Segers, personal working collection, Brussels, Belgium.

name: Musée Royal de l’Afrique Centrale (MRAC)
definition: Musée Royal de l’Afrique Centrale (MRAC).  Tervuren, Belgium. URL for main institutional website: http://www.africamuseum.be

name: Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Milano (MSNM)
definition: Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Milano (MSNM). Milan, Italy. URL for main institutional website: http://www.comune.milano.it/museostorianaturale/index.html

name: University of Texas (UTEP)
definition: University of Texas (UTEP). El Paso, Texas, USA. URL for main institutional website: http://www.utep.edu/museum/

name: American Museum of Natural History (AMNH)
definition: American Museum of Natural History (AMNH).  New York, New York, USA. URL for main institutional website: http://www.amnh.org/

name: ova diameter
definition: Diameter of a spherical ovum or egg cell.

name: Peabody Museum of Natural History (YPM)
definition:
Peabody Museum of Natural History (YPM).  New Haven, Connecticut, USA.
The Yale Peabody Museum's collections are available to legitimate researchers for scholarly use. Loans are issued to responsible individuals at established institutions. Loans and access to the collection can be arranged through the Collections Manager of the appropriate Division. http://www.peabody.yale.edu/collections/index.html
URL for main institutional website: http://www.peabody.yale.edu/

name: Oberösterreichisches Landesmuseum (OLML)
definition: Oberösterreichisches Landesmuseum (OLML). Linz, Austria. URL for main institutional website: http://www.biologiezentrum.at

name: Schmaulhausen Institute of Zoology (SIZK)
definition: Schmaulhausen Institute of Zoology (SIZK). Kiev, Ukraine

name: Mahasarakham University (MSUT)
definition: Mahasarakham University (MSUT). Kantarawichai, Maha Sarakham Province, Thailand. URL for main institutional website: http://www.science.msu.ac.th/MSU_Science2/html/museum.html

name: Canadian Museum of Nature (CMN)
definition:
Canadian Museum of Nature (CMN).  Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. 
URL for main institutional website: http://www.nature.ca
Formerly National Museum of Natural Sciences

name: Saudi Arabian National Museum of Natural History (SNMNH)
definition: Saudi Arabian National Museum of Natural History (SNMNH). Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

name: Brunei Museum (BMKB)
definition: Brunei Museum (BMKB).  Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei

name: Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazonia (INPA)
definition:
Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazonia (INPA). Manaus, Amazonia, Brazil.
URL for main institutional website: http://www.inpa.gov.br

name: El Colegio de la Frontera Sur (Mexico) (ECOSUR)
definition: Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

name: Khon Kaen University (KKU)
definition: Khon Kaen University (KKU), Khon Kaen, Thailand.

name: Natural History Museum, London (NHMUK)
definition: Natural History Museum, London (NHMUK). London, United Kingdom.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.nhm.ac.uk/

name: Prince of Songkla University (PSU)
definition: Prince of Songkla University (PSU).  Hat Yai, Songkhla, Thailand. Hat Yai is also called Haad Yai or Ban Hat Yai.

name: Zoology Museum of the University of Ghent (UGMD)
definition: Zoology Museum of the University of Ghent (UGMD).  Ghent, Belgium. URL for main institutional website: http://intramar.ugent.be/museumdierkunde/index.asp?c=99

name: Lund University (MZLU)
definition: Lund University (MZLU).  Lund, Sweden.

name: Museu de Zoologia da Universidade de Sao Paulo (MZUSP)
definition: Museu de Zoologia da Universidade de Sao Paulo (MZUSP).  Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil. URL for main institutional website: http://www.mz.usp.br/

name: Zoological Institute, Russian Academy of Sciences (ZISP)
definition: Zoological Institute, Russian Academy of Sciences (ZISP).  St. Petersburg, Russia. URL for main institutional website: http://www.zin.ru/index_e.htm

name: South Australia Museum (SAMA)
definition: South Australia Museum (SAMA). Adelaide, South Australia. URL for main institutional website: http://www.samuseum.sa.gov.au

name: Koste Collection
definition: Koste Collection, Quakenbrück, Germany.

name: Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle (MNHN)
definition: Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle (MNHN), Paris, France. URL for main institutional website: http://www.mnhn.fr/museum/foffice/science/science/sommaire.xsp

name: Western Australian Museum (WAM)
definition:
Western Australian Museum (WAM).  Welshpool (Perth), Western Australia. Museum covering natural, geological, earth and planetary sciences, anthroplogy, terrestrial and maritime archaeology, and social and maritime history. URL for main institutional website: http://www.museum.wa.gov.au
URL for institutional specimen catalog: (empty)
URL for institutional webservices: http://tapir.austmus.gov.au/tapirlink/tapir.php/ozcam_wam

name: Zoologisches Museum der Universitaet Kiel (ZMK)
definition: Zoologisches Museum der Universitaet Kiel (ZMK). Kiel, Germany.

name: Instituto National de Limnologia (INALI)
definition: Instituto National de Limnologia (INALI). Santo Tome, Argentina.

name: Shiel collection
definition: Shiel collection (MDFRC), Australia.  Russell J. Shiel, Univ. of Adelaide.

name: University of Antwerp
definition: University of Antwerp, Department of Biology, Antwerp, Belgium

name: Fujian Normal University (FNU)
definition:
Fujian Normal University (FNU). Fuzhou, Fujian,
 China.  Formerly Zoology and Botany Institute of Fujian Academy of Sciences, Science Institute of Fuzhou University, and Fujian Teachers College.

name: Nihon University, Biology Laboratory
definition: Biology Laboratory, Nihon Daigaku, Saitama, Japan.

Australian Museum (AM), Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. Includes Arachnology, Entomology, Malacology, Marine Invertebrate, Herpetology, Ichthyology, Mammalogy, and Ornithology collections. All catalogued as one collection.

URL for main institutional website: http://www.australianmuseum.net.au
URL for institutional specimen catalog: http://collections.australianmuseum.net.au/amweb/pages/am/Query.php

name: University of Waterloo (BDUW)
definition: University of Waterloo (BDUW), Waterloo, Ontario, Canada.

name: Robert Nachtwey Collection
definition: Robert Nachtwey, personal collection, Jena, Germany

name: Zoological Survey of India (ZSIC)
definition: Zoological Survey of India (ZSIC). Kolkata (Calcutta), India.  URL for main institutional website: http://envfor.nic.in/zsi/

name: Museum of Zoology at the University of Bergen, Invertebrate Collection (ZMBN)

definition: Zoological Museum, University of Copenhagen (ZMUC). Copenhagen, Denmark.	 URL for main institutional website: http://www.zmuc.dk/HeadWeb/collections.htm

definition: South African Museum (SAM). Cape Town, South Africa.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.iziko.org.za/sam/

name: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales (MNCN)
definition: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales (MNCN).  Madrid, Spain. URL for main institutional website: http://www.mncn.csic.es

definition: Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales Bernardino Rivadavia (MACN).  Buenos Aires, Argentina.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.macn.secyt.gov.ar/instituc.htm

name: Universidad de Morón
definition: Universidad de Morón, Buenos Aires, Argentina. URL for main institutional website: http://www.unimoron.edu.ar/

definition: Estonian Academy of Sciences, Vörtsjärv Limnological Station, Estonia. URL for main institutional website: http://www.akadeemia.ee/et/akadeemia/kontakt/

name: Academy of Science, Uzbekistan (TASH)

name: Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria, Estación Experimental Agropecuaria (CRP)
definition: Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria, Estación Experimental Agropecuaria (CRP).  I.N.T.A., E.E.A. Bariloche, Río Negro, Argentina

definition: Canterbury Museum (CMNZ). URL for main institutional website: http://www.canterburymuseum.com/

definition: North-Eastern Hill University, Zoology Department. Shillong, India.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.nehu.ac.in/

name: Murray Darling Freshwater Research Center
definition: Murray Darling Freshwater Research Center, Wodonga, Victoria, Australia.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.mdfrc.org.au/

definition: Tokyo Kyoiku University (TKU). Tokyo, Japan.  TKU transferred to TKB: http://biocol.org/urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:14652

name: Science Centre Singapore
definition: Science Centre Singapore. Singapore. URL for main institutional website: http://www.science.edu.sg/

name: Zoological Museum, Moscow Lomonosov State University (ZMMU)
definition: Zoological Museum, Moscow Lomonosov State University (ZMMU).  Moscow, Russia. URL for main institutional website: http://zmmu.msu.ru/eng/

definition: Institute of Hydrobiology, Chinese Academy of Sciences (IHB). Wuhan, China. URL for main institutional website: http://159.226.163.238/english/default.aspx

definition: I. D. Papanin Institute for Biology of Inland Waters, Russian Academy of Sciences (IBIW).  Borock, Russia.

definition: Indian Museum (IM).  Calcutta, India.  URL for main institutional website: http://indianmuseumkolkata.org/

definition: Harbin Normal University (HANU).  Harbin, Heilongjiang, China.  Formerly Harbin Teachers School (1953) and Harbin Normal College (1958).

name: Christ College
definition: Christ College, Irinjalakuda, Kerala, India. URL for main institutional website: http://www.christcollegeijk.edu.in/

definition: Moscow State Unversity, Biological Laboratory. Moscow, Russia. URL for main institutional website:  http://www.bio.msu.ru/

definition: Zhongshan (Sun Yatsen) University (SYS).  Guangzhou, Guangdong, China.  URL for main institutional website: http://www.sysu.edu.cn/museum/creature/  Permission for loans required from Forestry Ministry, People's Republic of China.

name: Museum für Naturkunde Berlin (Zoological Collections) (ZMB)
definition: Museum für Naturkunde Berlin (Zoological Collections) (ZMB).  Berlin, Germany. URL for main institutional website: http://www.naturkundemuseum-berlin.de  Formerly Zoologisches Museum der Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin

name: Museo Provincial de Ciencias Naturales Florentino Ameghino (MFA)
definition: Museo Provincial de Ciencias Naturales Florentino Ameghino (MFA). Santa Fe, Santa Fe, Argentina. URL for main institutional website: http://www.unl.edu.ar/santafe.muesocn/htm

name: Scripps Institution of Oceanography Benthic Invertebrates Collection (SIO-BIC)
definition: Scripps Institution of Oceanography Benthic Invertebrates Collection (SIO-BIC). La Jolla, California, USA. Primarily specimens in liquid at room temperature (alcohol, formalin)

name: breeding habitat
definition: Primary habitat where the species breeds.

name: permanent freshwater habitat
definition: Any still, freshwater habitat that is not temporary

name: strontium yellow
definition: A shade of yellow the same color as strontium

name: Cornflower Blue
definition: A shade of blue the same color as the petals of the cornflower.

name: lemon yellow
definition: An unstandardized color name that refers to colors resembling the skin of a lemon. The web version of lemon yellow is #FFF44F.

name: golden brown
definition: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold_(color)#Golden_brown

name: old gold
definition: A very dark yellow color with olive and brown mixed in.

name: pearl grey
definition: A grey color with a pearly lustre

name: pinkish cinnamon
definition: A color that is a mixture of pink and brown.

name: oval two dimensional
definition: A circular quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer having two axes of symmetry -  one axis longer than the other.

name: rhomboid
definition: A spheroid quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being oval and a little angular in the middle.

name: Bean Shaped Two Dimensional
definition: A 2-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having the outline of a kidney or bean.

name: stipe
definition: In fungi: A stalk or stem; composed of hyphae arrayed parallel to the long axis of the structure; a stipe may be a single supporting hypha

name: hymenium
definition: The spore-bearing layer of the fruiting body of certain fungi, containing asci or basidia.

name: edibility
definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's disposition to being fit to be eaten.

name: edible
definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being suitable for use as food.

name: inedible
definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer not being suitable for use as food.

name: allergen
definition: A material entity bearing the disposition to cause an allergic reaction

name: fatal
definition: fatal is a qualitative intensity value that is more intense than severe, leading to the death/non-functioning of a system.

name: poisonous
definition: Hazardous or Poisonous Substance

name: psychoactive
definition: Psychoactive substance

name: red brown
definition: A color consisting of red and brown hue.

name: pink
definition: Red color having medium to high brightness and low to moderate saturation.

name: yellow brown
definition: A color consisting of yellow and brown hue.

name: unornamented
definition: A surface feature shape in which the bearer's surface is lacking ridges, pits, rugosity or other surface structures.

name: convex
definition: A shape quality that obtains by virtue of the bearer having inward facing edges; having a surface or boundary that curves or bulges outward, as the exterior of a sphere.

name: umbonate
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a knob or knoblike protuberance.

name: flat
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a horizontal surface without a slope, tilt, or curvature.

name: offset
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's position being displaced from a reference point.

name: arbuscular mycorrhizal association
definition: A form of mutualism between a fungus and the roots of a vascular plant, where hyphae of the fungus penetrate the plant cell wall and invaginate its cell membrane. Once inside, the fungus forms highly branched structures for nutrient exchange with the plant called arbuscules. Aids in the acquisition by the plant of nutrients such as phosphorus from the soil.

name: plastoneotype
definition: A copy or cast of neotype material.

name: exparatype
definition: A living culture obtained from a paratype may be referred to as an ex-paratype. It is linked to the paratype, but it is not the same as the paratype.

name: exholotype
definition: A living culture obtained from a holotype may be referred to as an ex-holotype. It is linked to the holotype, but it is not the same as the holotype.

name: extype
definition: A living culture obtained from a type may be referred to as an ex-type. It is linked to the type, but it is not the same as the type.

name: exepitype
definition: A living culture obtained from an epitype may be referred to as an ex-epitype. It is linked to the epitype, but it is not the same as the epitype.

name: original material
definition: Any specimens from the lot containing the primary type material for a species, collected in the same time and place, and of the same species, are original material for that species. This includes the primary type specimens as well as other specimens not designated as types.

name: questionable
definition: There is (little) evidence for the presence of a taxon but it might exist here

name: geographic distribution includes
definition: This organism is known to be present in this location or region

name: absent from region
definition: This organism is known to be absent in this location or region

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Division of Birds
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. USNM bird specimens are cited without a collection code (USNM:xxxxx) 610,000+ specimens representing ~80% of bird species. Skins, skeletal and fluid-preserved tissue collections, egg sets, nests, frozen tissues. Almost 4,000 type specimens.  URL for collection: http://vertebrates.si.edu/birds/ URL for collection's specimen catalog/database: http://collections.mnh.si.edu/search/birds/

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Entomology Collection
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. Primarily dried specimens (e.g., skins, herbarium sheets).  URL for collection: http://darwin.si.edu/Darwin/MuseumOffices/entomology.html

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) National Fish Collection
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. Includes Smithsonian Institution collections and National Marine Fisheries Service collections, NOAA, Department of Commerce.  Primarily specimens in liquid at room temperature (alcohol, formalin).  URL for collection: http://vertebrates.si.edu/fishes/fishes_collections.html

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Division of Amphibians and Reptiles
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. 570,000 cataloged specimens, most in 70% ethanol. Catalog numbers overlap with other museum divisions, but the herp collection code is not currently used formally when citing specimens.  Primarily specimens in liquid at room temperature (alcohol, formalin). URL for collection: http://vertebrates.si.edu/herps/

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Department of Invertebrate Zoology
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. 35 million specimens of all 30 major non-insect invertebrate phyla. Specimens housed in both the main NMNH building and at the Museum Support Center.  Primarily specimens in liquid at room temperature (alcohol, formalin).  URL for collection: http://invertebrates.si.edu/index.htm

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Division of Mammals
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. Roughly 590,000 preserved specimens. Collection supports a wide range of scientific research by resident staff and associates, as well as numerous visiting scientists.  Primarily dried specimens (e.g., skins, herbarium sheets).  URL for collection: http://vertebrates.si.edu/mammals/

name: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM) Department of Paleobiology
definition: National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution (USNM), Washington, District of Columbia, USA. URL for department website: http://paleobiology.si.edu/index.html

name: female flowers
definition: The life stage of a plant when the female flowers are in bloom.

name: fertile
definition: A fertility quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being capable of initiating, sustaining, or supporting reproduction.

name: whole plant flowering stage (flowering)
definition: A sporophyte reproductive stage (PO:0007130) during which a flower (PO:0009046) on a whole plant (PO:0000003) is open.

name: whole plant fruit development stage (fruiting)
definition: A sporophyte reproductive stage that begins when a fruit (PO:0009001) on a whole plant (PO:0000003) that is not currently participating in a whole plant fruit development stage begins a fruit initiation stage (PO:0025503), and ends with the earliest of the following: (1) the whole plant begins a sporophyte senescent stage (PO:0007017), (2) the whole plant begins a sporophyte dormant stage (PO:0007132), or (3) all fruits on the whole plant are finished ripening.

name: early whole plant fruit ripening stage
definition: The early stage in fruit ripening.

name: in bud
definition: The stage of a plant when it has small protuberances on the stem or branch, sometimes enclosed in protective scales and containing an undeveloped shoot, leaf, or flower.

name: male flowers
definition: The life stage of a plant when the female flowers are in bloom.

name: whole plant fruit ripening complete stage
definition: The stage at which fruit ripening is complete.

name: sporophyte vegetative stage
definition: A sporophyte development stage (PO:0028002) that occurs during the interval between the first division of a plant zygote (PO:0000423) and the formation of a sporangium (PO:0025094).

name: isoepitype
definition: A duplicate specimen of the epitype.

name: clonotype
definition: Botany: A living cultivated specimen prepared from a vegetatively propagated part of a plant from which the type specimen was also obtained.  Zoology: An asexually propagated specimen from a part of a nomenclatural type.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature.  The naming of organisms (and plant communities).  Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: homotype
definition:
(1) Any specimen that has been directly compared with the holotype by someone other than the original author who is recognized as an authority on the group of organisms concerned and considered to belong to the same species or subspecies; see also
metatype. (2) (prok., unoff.) a strain of the same species and the nomenclatural type.

name: isoparatype
definition: A duplicate specimen of a paratype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: lectoallotype
definition: A specimen of the opposite sex to a holotype or lectotype selected after the original publication of the name from the original material; an allolectotype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: morphotype
definition: The type specimen of a different morph of a dimorphic or polymorphic species.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: paratopotype
definition:
A paratype from the same locality as the
holotype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: plastoholotype
definition:
An artificial specimen moulded directly form
a holotype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: plastolectotype
definition:
An artificial specimen moulded directly
from a lectotype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: plastoparalectotype
definition:
An artificial specimen moulded directly
form a paralectotype.

name: plastoparatype
definition: An artificial specimen moulded directly from a paratype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: plastosyntype
definition: An artificial specimen moulded directly from a syntype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: plastotype
definition:
An artificial specimen moulded or otherwise
reproduced directly from a type; particularly used for fossils.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: plesiotype
definition:
(1) A specimen which was not used in the
original description of a species or subspecies, but which is used for a later redescription supplementing the description or illustration published subsequent to the original description; a hypotype; see
also epitype. (2) A specimen related to the type
species of a genus-group name but from another biological province or geological formation. (3) A figured or described specimen which has been compared with the type specimen or original figure. (4) A specimen identified by a later author as the same as a type.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: primary type
definition:
The specimen on which the description of a
new species-group name is based; a basic type (q.v.) or proterotype (q.v.); see also holotype.
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: pseudotype
definition:
(1) The type of a genus-group name which has
been erroneously designated; a false type. (2) A
duplicate of a type specimen which was not studied by the author describing the taxon (e.g. one with the same collection details but deposited in a different institution).
attribution: Hawksworth, D. L. 2010. Terms Used in Bionomenclature. The naming of organisms (and plant communities). Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Copenhagen.

name: type fragment
definition: A part or fragment of a type specimen.  Syn. clastotype.

name: holotype fragment
definition: A part or fragment of a holotype specimen.

name: isolectotype fragment
definition: A part or fragment of an isolectotype specimen.

name: isosyntype fragment
definition: A part or fragment of an isosyntype specimen.

name: isotype fragment
definition: A part or fragment of an isotype specimen.

name: lectotype fragment
definition: A part or fragment of a lectotype specimen.

name: syntype fragment
definition: A part or fragment of a syntype specimen.

name: saprotrophic
definition: Nutritional strategy relies on chemically decomposing diverse carbon sources (eg: cellulose in wood, by saprotrophic fungi)

name: parasite
definition: An organism bearing a parasite role

name: decurrent
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being prolonged below the point of insertion.

name: detached
definition: An attachment quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's lacking connection or association with another entity. (eg: in mushroom fruiting bodies, hymenium can be detached or "free")

name: ridged
definition: An elongated raised margin or border.

name: toothed
definition: A surface feature shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having toothlike projections in the margin.

name: dark brown
definition: A color consisting of brown hue and low brightness.

name: olive green
definition: Brown green. A color consisting of brown and green hues.

name: dark purple
definition: A color consisting of purple color and low brightness.

name: pentagonal shape
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer a cross section shape of a pentagon. This is a 2D shape.

name: flattened
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's surface becoming more extended in a plane.

name: posterior right side location
definition: A location inside an organism in the posterior section of the body/cell and to the organism's own right side.

name: dome Shape
definition: A curvature quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a shape resembling a dome.

name: Center Right Location
definition: A location within an organism that is in the center of the body or cell and deflected to the organism's right side.

name: rectangular
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of it being a quadrilateral polygon in which all four angles are right angles.

name: humic water
definition: An aquatic habitat characterized by high concentration of humic acids.

name: fusiform
definition: Having a spindle-like shape that is wide in the middle and tapers at both ends.

name: laterally compressed
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being flattened along transverse axis.

name: striated
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being marked by narrow lines or grooves, usually parallel.

name: irregularly lobed
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being partly divided into a determinate number of regions that are lacking symmetry or evenness.
attribution: modified by Anne Thessen from PATO

name: posterior left location
definition: A location inside an organism in the posterior section of the body/cell and to the organism's own left side.

name: sigmoid
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's consisting of two curves, in opposite directions. S-shaped.

name: loop shape
definition: A shape produced by a curved line that bends around and crosses itself or would cross itself if it were long enough.

name: branched
definition: A branchiness quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having branches.

name: polyhaline
definition: Water with a salinity between 18 and 30

name: asymmetric oval 2D
definition: A two dimensional oval shape (circular shape with two axes of symmetry - one axis longer than the other) that is displaced along the longer axis.

name: asymmetric oval 3D
definition: A three dimensional oval shape (circular shape with two axes of symmetry - one axis longer than the other) that is displaced along the longer axis.

name: hemiellipse
definition: A shape distinguished by its resemblance to a half oval or ellipse - 3D

name: yellowish grey
definition: grey color tinged with yellow

name: double funnel shape
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's similarity to the appearance of two funnels attached at the wide opening. This is a 2D shape.

name: pinkish grey
definition: grey color with a hint of pink

name: Circle Triangle Shape
definition: A shape that resembles a half circle sitting on a triangle, can also be called an "ice cream cone" shape. This is a 2D shape.

name: mesohaline
definition: Salinity between 5 and 18

name: deflected to the right
definition: A shape quality inhering in the bearer a bend or deflection to the right (the organism's right)

name: asymmetric cone
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer the shape of a cone in which the distance from the point to the base circumference is not the same at all points along the circumference. This is a 3D shape.

name: epicone wider than hypocone
definition: A 3D cell shape specific to dinoflagellates in which the epicone is wider than the hypocone.

name: hypocone wider than epicone
definition: A 3D cell shape for a dinoflagellate in which the hypocone is wider than the epicone.

name: gold
definition: A color that is a variety of orange-yellow color blends. This is not metallic gold. The hex triplet is #FFD700.

name: square
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having an equal-sided rectangular form.

name: facultative
definition: Organism can occur with or without this condition

name: obligate
definition: Healthy organisms are not found outside this condition. Required.

name: never
definition: Healthy organism never found within this condition

name: string colony
definition: A type of colony in which the organisms are linked together one after another, similar to beads on a string.

name: hexagonal grid
definition: A texture quality inhering in a bearer a surface with the appearance of a "honey comb" that consists of a series of hexagons.

name: anterio-posteriorly compressed
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being flattened along the antero-posterior axis.

name: sandy mud
definition: A sediment/soil habitat consisting of sand and mid in a ratio of less than 1:4

name: golden yellow
definition: color halfway between amber and yellow on the RGB color wheel. It is a color that is 87.5% yellow and 12.5% red. The hex triplet is #FFDF00.

name: infundibuliform
definition: Funnel shaped

name: lamellate
definition: Plate-like erect

name: concave
definition: A shape quality in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's curving inward.

name: inconspicuous
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of not being clearly visible. (eg: for a mushroom cap, "indistinct")

name: choice
definition: Edible and highly sought after

name: not recommended
definition: For edible organisms: not recommended for human consumption

name: unpalatable
definition: For edible organisms: edible, but unpalatable

name: gleba
definition: The fleshy, spore-bearing inner mass of a puffball.

name: adnate
definition: In mushrooms: hymenium is broadly attached to the stem

name: adnexed
definition: In mushrooms: hymenium is narrowly attached to the stem

name: seceding
definition: In mushrooms: hymenium is pulling away from the stem at the lower edge of the attachment

name: ring
definition: In mushrooms: the stipe bears a partial veil, protecting the hymenium in the early stages of growth. As the spores mature, the cap expands, tearing away from the veil, which is left hanging on the stalk as the annulus or ring.

name: spore print
definition: The spore print is the powdery deposit obtained by allowing spores of a fungal fruit body to fall onto a surface underneath. It is an important diagnostic character in most handbooks for identifying mushrooms. It shows the color of the mushroom spores if viewed en masse.

name: volva
definition:
The universal veil or volva is a layer of tissue that completely surrounds the baby mushroom (in some species), making it look like an egg at first (or, more dangerously for the edible-mushroom hunter, a puffball). 
When the mushroom grows, it breaks out of the universal veil, leaving bits of it attached to various parts of the mushroom.

name: cortina
definition: In mushrooms: the stipe bears a veil (the cortina), protecting the hymenium in the early stages of growth.

name: purple brown
definition: A color consisting of purple and brown hue.

name: tan
definition: Brown color having medium to high brightness and low to moderate saturation

name: buff
definition: Brown color having high brightness and low to moderate saturation

name: cream
definition: Brown color having high brightness and low saturation

name: salmon
definition: A color consisting of red and brown hues, having medium to high brightness and low saturation.

name: olive brown
definition: A color consisting of brown and green hues, predominantly brown.

name: pink brown
definition: A color consisting of red and brown hues, having medium brightness and moderate saturation.

name: mushroom cap shape
definition: Approximate 3D shape of the cap of the mushroom.

name: irregular
definition: irregular shape

name: conserved type
definition: A type specimen associated with a conserved name.

name: conserved isotype
definition: An isotype specimen associated with a conserved name.

name: unconfirmed clonotype
definition: A specimen that may be a clonotype, but its type status has not yet been confirmed.

name: unconfirmed cotype
definition: A specimen that may be a cotype, but its type status has not yet been confirmed.

name: unconfirmed holotype
definition: A specimen that may be a holotype, but its type status has not yet been confirmed.

name: unconfirmed isolectotype

name: male and female
definition: Both male and female individuals are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: hermaphrodite
definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an organism or a population with both male and female sexual organs in one individual.

name: male, female, and hermaphrodite
definition: Male, female, and hermaphrodite individuals are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: male and hermaphrodite
definition: Both male and hermaphrodite individuals are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: female and hermaphrodite
definition: Both female and hermaphrodite individuals are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: ovigerous
definition: Bearing or carrying eggs.

name: manca
definition: The manca (plural: mancae) are post-larval juveniles in some crustaceans. The manca stage is the defining characteristic of a clade called Mancoida which comprises all the member of the Peracarida except the Amphipoda. Mancae closely resemble the adult form, but for the absence of the last pair of pereiopods.

name: praniza
definition: The manca (post-larval juvenile) in the isopod family Cymothoidae.  This stage is parasitic on fish.

name: copepodid
definition: In copepods, the larval stage following the naupliar stages. The copepodid has the same number of body segments and appendages in all copepods. The copepodid larva has two pairs of unsegmented swimming appendages, and an unsegmented "hind-body" comprising the thorax and the abdomen. There are typically five copepodid stages, but parasitic copepods may stop after a single copepodid stage. Once the gonads develop, there are no further moults.

name: gravid adult
definition: Containing a developing embryo, fetus, or unborn offspring within the body.

name: hatchling
definition: An animal that has recently emerged from its egg.

name: megalopa stage
definition: The crustacean post-larval stage of a crab

name: non-breeding
definition: An organism that is not mating or reproducing.

name: non-ovigerous
definition: Not bearing or carrying eggs.

name: nymph
definition: Any of various immature insects; especially: a larva of an insect (as a grasshopper, true bug, or mayfly) with incomplete metamorphosis that differs from the imago especially in size and in its incompletely developed wings and genitalia.

name: metamorph
definition: An animal (usually an amphibian) which is undergoing metamorphosis.

name: postmetamorph
definition: An animal (usually an amphibian) which has recently completed metamorphosis.

name: pupa
definition: An organism at the pupal stage. A life cycle stage of holometabolous insects in which the organism is a pupa and starts with the larval-pupal apolysis and ends with pupal-adult apolysis.

name: Blue Grey
definition: A color that is grey with blue mixed in

name: frustoconical
definition: A 3D shape that resembles a cone with the pointy end removed OR a cylinder with one round base larger in diameter than the other.

name: stellate
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being arranged like rays or radii; radiating from a common center. - star-shaped

name: bluish pink
definition: http://www.colourlovers.com/color/FDAFDD/Bluish_Pink

name: tear-drop shape
definition: A convex 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's shape resembling falling drop.

name: anterior left location
definition: A location inside an organism in the anterior section of the body/cell and to the organism's own left side.

name: angular
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having at least one salient angle on the margin.

name: asymmetric hemisphere
definition: A 3D shape that resembles a hemisphere that is not symmetrical

name: pair
definition: A group or colony of organisms that takes the form of two individuals physically attached together

name: euryhaline
definition: Quality of an organism that inheres the ability to tolerate a wide range of salinity

name: reniform
definition: A concave 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having the shape of a kidney.

name: flowering and fruiting
definition: The reproductive stage of a plant during which there are both open flowers and developing or ripe fruits present.

name: adult and larva
definition: Both adult organisms and larvae are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: adult and nymph
definition: Both adult organisms and nymphs are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: adult alate
definition: An alate is a winged reproductive of a social insect (especially ants or termites, but the term can also be applied to aphids and some thrips).

name: adult apterous
definition: An adult individual without wings.

name: adult brachypterous
definition: An adult individual with reduced wings.

name: adult and pupa
definition: Both adult organisms and pupae are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: larva and pupa
definition: Both larvae and pupae are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: alatoid nymph
definition: A late instar insect nymph with wing pads, destined to become an alate adult.

name: apterous nymph
definition: A late instar insect nymph without wing pads, destined to become an apterous adult.

name: juvenile and ovigerous
definition: Both juvenile and ovigerous organisms are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: immature and ovigerous
definition: Both immature and ovigerous organisms are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: adult and subadult
definition: Both adult and subadult organisms are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: adult and juvenile
definition: Both adult and juvenile organisms are represented in a sample or an occurrence.

name: prototype
definition: (Zoological, unofficial) A primary type or proterotype

A specimen, other than the type, upon which a
subsequent or supplementary description

name: genoholotype

name

name: inch
definition: An inch (plural: inches; abbreviation or symbol: in or ″ – a double prime) is a unit of length in the imperial and United States customary systems of measurement. Historically an inch was also used in a number of other systems of units. Traditional standards for the exact length of an inch have varied in the past, but now the imperial or US customary inch is defined to be exactly 25.4 mm. There are 12 inches in a foot and therefore 36 inches in a yard.

name: optimal growth temperature
definition: Optimal temperature conditions for cell division

name: optimal growth pH
definition: Optimal pH conditions for cell division

name: methanogenesis
definition: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of methane, a colorless, odorless, flammable gas with the formula CH4. It is the simplest of the alkanes.

name: sulfur reduction
definition: An anaerobic respiration process in which elemental sulfur is reduced.

name: sulfur oxidation
definition: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting the addition of oxygen to elemental sulfur.

name: sulfide oxidation
definition: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the conversion of sulfide to elemental sulfur in a higher oxidation state, or to sulfite or sulfate.

name: sulfate/thiosulfate reduction
definition: The process of anaerobic respiration, where thiosulfate is both oxidized to sulfate and reduced to hydrogen sulfide

name: nifH gene
definition: Gene encoding the nitrogenase enzyme

name: nitrate reduction
definition: The process of anaerobic respiration, where nitrate is reduced to nitrite, nitric oxide, nitrous oxide, or dinitrogen

name: oxygen metabolism
definition: The chemical reactions and pathways involving diatomic oxygen (O2).

name: mesophile
definition: An organism that grows best in moderate temperature, typically between 20 and 45 °C

name: thermophile
definition: An organism that thrives at relatively high temperatures, between 41 and 122 °C

name: hyperthermophile
definition: An organism that thrives in extremely hot environments— from 60 °C upwards

name: neutrophile
definition: An organism that thrives in neutral pH environments.

name: moderate acidophile
definition: An organism that thrives under moderately acidic conditions (usually pH 2.0 to 7.0).

name: extreme acidophile
definition: An organism that thrives under highly acidic conditions (usually at pH 2.0 or below).

name: anaerobic
definition: The enzymatic release of energy from inorganic and organic compounds (especially carbohydrates and fats) which uses compounds other than oxygen (e.g. nitrate, sulfate) as the terminal electron acceptor.

name: aerobic
definition: The enzymatic release of energy from inorganic and organic compounds (especially carbohydrates and fats) which requires oxygen as the terminal electron acceptor.

name: freshwater/brackish
definition: A habitat that is in water containing no or low concentrations of dissolved salts (typically <20 salinity)

name: male or unsexed
definition: male or unsexed individuals are represented in a sample or an occurrence.
